revision.text:
'''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician and a Member of Parliament currently serving as the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis|People’s Majilis]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majlis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |access-date=2023-04-22 |website=majlis.gov.mv}}</ref> She is a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] and has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency.
{{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = | caption = ... | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = 8 February 1978 (age 45) | constituency = | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)</br>[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = Eva Abdulla | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termstart1 = 2009 | constituency1 = [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | predecessor = [[Moosa Manik]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) }}

revision.comment: Added tags to the page using [[Wikipedia:Page Curation|Page Curation]] (blp sources)
formatting; add sort tag and cat

{{BLP sources|date=April 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = | caption = ... | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|8|df=y}} | constituency = | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)</br>[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = Eva Abdulla | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termstart1 = 2009 | constituency1 = [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | predecessor = [[Moosa Manik]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician and a Member of Parliament currently serving as the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis|People’s Majilis]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majlis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |access-date=2023-04-22 |website=majlis.gov.mv}}</ref> She is a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] and has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency.

{{BLP sources|date=April 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = | caption = ... | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|8|df=y}} | constituency = | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)
[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = Eva Abdulla | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termstart1 = 2009 | constituency1 = [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | predecessor = [[Moosa Manik]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician and a Member of Parliament currently serving as the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis|People's Majilis]].{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majlis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |access-date=2023-04-22 |website=majlis.gov.mv}} She is a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] and has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency. ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]]

[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = Eva Abdulla | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termstart1 = 2009 | constituency1 = [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | predecessor = [[Moosa Manik]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician and a Member of Parliament currently serving as the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis|People's Majilis]].{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majlis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |access-date=2023-04-22 |website=majlis.gov.mv}} She is a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] and has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency. ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

{{BLP sources|date=April 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = | caption = ... | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|8|df=y}} | constituency = | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)
[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = Eva Abdulla | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termstart1 = 2009 | constituency1 = [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | predecessor = [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Moosa Manik]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician and a Member of Parliament currently serving as the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis|People's Majilis]].{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majlis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |access-date=2023-04-22 |website=majlis.gov.mv}} She is a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] and has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency. ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

{{BLP sources|date=April 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = | caption = ... | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|8|df=y}} | constituency = | party = [[Independent politician|Independent]] | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)
[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termstart1 = 2009 | constituency1 = [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | predecessor = [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Moosa Manik]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) | honorific_prefix = Deputy speaker | otherparty = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] (2008-2023) }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician and a Member of Parliament currently serving as the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis|People's Majilis]].{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majlis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |access-date=2023-04-22 |website=majlis.gov.mv}} She has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency and was a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]], up until she left the party in May 2023. Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. In 2019, she was the second woman to have presided over a parliament meeting as speaker, with the first being former deputy Speaker [[Aneesa Ahmed]] in 2008.{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker Eva chairs parliament, second woman to do so |url=http://edition.mv/news/10986 |access-date=2023-05-31 |website=The Edition |language=en}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

{{BLP sources|date=April 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = | caption = ... | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|8|df=y}} | constituency = | party = [[Independent politician|Independent]] | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)
[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termstart1 = 2009 | constituency1 = [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | predecessor = [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Moosa Manik]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) | honorific_prefix = Deputy speaker | otherparty = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] (2008-2023) }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician and a Member of Parliament currently serving as the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis]].{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majlis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |access-date=2023-04-22 |website=majlis.gov.mv}} She has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency and was a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]], up until she left the party in May 2023. Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. In 2019, she was the second woman to have presided over a parliament meeting as speaker, with the first being former deputy Speaker [[Aneesa Ahmed]] in 2008.{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker Eva chairs parliament, second woman to do so |url=http://edition.mv/news/10986 |access-date=2023-05-31 |website=The Edition |language=en}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termstart1 = 2009 | constituency1 = [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | predecessor = [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Moosa Manik]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) | honorific_prefix = Deputy speaker | otherparty = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] (2008-2023) }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician and a Member of Parliament currently serving as the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis]].{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majlis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |access-date=2023-04-22 |website=majlis.gov.mv}} She has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency and was a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]], up until she left the party in May 2023. Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. In 2019, she was the second woman to have presided over a parliament meeting as speaker, with the first being former deputy Speaker [[Aneesa Ahmed]] in 2008.{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker Eva chairs parliament, second woman to do so |url=http://edition.mv/news/10986 |access-date=2023-05-31 |website=The Edition |language=en}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. In 2019, she was the second woman to have presided over a parliament meeting as speaker, with the first being former deputy Speaker [[Aneesa Ahmed]] in 2008.{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker Eva chairs parliament, second woman to do so |url=http://edition.mv/news/10986 |access-date=2023-05-31 |website=The Edition |language=en}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. In 2019, she was the second woman to have presided over a parliament meeting as speaker, with the first being former deputy Speaker [[Aneesa Ahmed]] in 2008.{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker Eva chairs parliament, second woman to do so |url=http://edition.mv/news/10986 |access-date=2023-05-31 |website=The Edition |language=en}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

She is a Member of Parliament.{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament resigns |url=https://vaguthu.mv/news/972796/ |access-date=2023-12-03 |website=vaguthu}} She has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency and was a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]], up until she left the party in May 2023. Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. {{Short description|Former deputy speaker at parliament Maldives}} {{BLP sources|date=April 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = Eva Abdulla at National Day 2019 (cropped).jpg | caption = Eva in 2019 | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|8|df=y}} | constituency = | party = [[The Democrats (Maldives)|Democrat]] (2023-present) | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)
[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termend = 3 December 2023 | termstart1 = 9 May 2009 | constituency1 = | predecessor = [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Moosa Manik]] | successor = [[Ahmed Saleem (deputy speaker)|Ahmed Saleem]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Aslam (member of parliament)|Mohamed Aslam]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) | otherparty = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] (2008-2023) | preceded1 = ''Constituency established'' }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician who was the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis]] until resignation in 3rd of December 2023. She is a Member of Parliament.{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament resigns |url=https://vaguthu.mv/news/972796/ |access-date=2023-12-03 |website=vaguthu}} She has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency and was a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]], up until she left the party in May 2023. She is now a member of The Democrats. Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. In 2019, she was the second woman to have presided over a parliament meeting as speaker, with the first being former deputy Speaker [[Aneesa Ahmed]] in 2008.{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker Eva chairs parliament, second woman to do so |url=http://edition.mv/news/10986 |access-date=2023-05-31 |website=The Edition |language=en}} In 2023, she resigned as deputy speaker in the midst of a [[Motion of no confidence|no-confidence motion]] being made against her by 50 parliamentarians. The motion was brought against her due to her withdrawal from the MDP in violation of an agreement that stated that she should remain an MDP candidate once elected on an MDP ticket.{{Cite web |last=raajje.mv |title=Eva resigns from post of Parliament Deputy Speaker |url=https://raajje.mv/146089 |access-date=2023-12-13 |website=raajje.mv |language=en}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Kent]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Warwick]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

{{Short description|Former deputy speaker at parliament Maldives}} {{BLP sources|date=April 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = Eva Abdulla at National Day 2019 (cropped).jpg | caption = Eva in 2019 | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|8|df=y}} | constituency = | party = [[The Democrats (Maldives)|The Democrats]] (2023-present) | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)
[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termend = 3 December 2023 | termstart1 = 9 May 2009 | constituency1 = | predecessor = [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Moosa Manik]] | successor = [[Ahmed Saleem (deputy speaker)|Ahmed Saleem]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Aslam (member of parliament)|Mohamed Aslam]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) | otherparty = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] (2008-2023) | preceded1 = ''Constituency established'' }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician who was the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis]] until resignation in 3rd of December 2023. She is a Member of Parliament.{{Cite news |last=Afeef |first=Azeeza |date=3 December 2023 |title=މަޖިލީހުގެ ނައިބު ރައީސް ކަމުން އީވާ އިސްތިއުފާ ދެއްވައިފި |language=dv |trans-title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament resigns |work=Vaguthu |url=https://vaguthu.mv/news/972796/ |access-date=2023-12-03}} She previously worked at the [[World Health Organization]], the [[United Nations Population Fund|UNFPA]], and was the Manager for the now-defunct local newspaper [[Minivan Daily]].{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majilis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230422103432/https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |archive-date=22 April 2023 |website=People's Majilis}} She has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency{{Cite news |date=19 June 2023 |title=Cannot remain for long without registering 'The Democrats': Eva |work=One |url=https://oneonline.mv/en/78311 |access-date=24 December 2023}} and was a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]], up until she left the party in May 2023. She is now a member of [[The Democrats (Maldives)|The Democrats]]. Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. In 2019, she was the second woman to have presided over a parliament meeting as speaker, with the first being former Deputy Speaker [[Aneesa Ahmed]] in 2008.{{Cite news |last=Jalyl |first=Raif Amyl |date=11 June 2019 |title=Deputy Speaker Eva chairs parliament, second woman to do so |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/news/10986 |access-date=2023-05-31}} In 2023, she resigned as deputy speaker in the midst of a [[Motion of no confidence|no-confidence motion]] being made against her by 50 parliamentarians. The motion was brought against her due to her withdrawal from the MDP in violation of an agreement that stated that she should remain an MDP candidate once elected on an MDP ticket.{{Cite news |last=Udhma |first=Fathimath |date=3 December 2023 |title=Eva resigns from post of Parliament Deputy Speaker |work=raajje.mv |url=https://raajje.mv/146089 |access-date=2023-12-13}} == Education == Eva graduated from the [[University of Kent]], holding a a BA in Politics and Government and a MA in Politics and International Relations from the [[University of Warwick]], [[England]], [[United Kingdom]]. ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Kent]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Warwick]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]

{{Short description|Former deputy speaker at parliament Maldives}} {{BLP sources|date=April 2023}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Eva Abdulla | image = Eva Abdulla at National Day 2019 (cropped).jpg | caption = Eva in 2019 | website = | office = Deputy Speaker of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] | native_name = އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|8|df=y}} | constituency = | party = [[The Democrats (Maldives)|The Democrats]] (2023-present) | alma_mater = [[University of Kent]] (BA)
[[University of Warwick]] (MA) | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] | office1 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] | termstart = 28 May 2019 | termend = 3 December 2023 | termstart1 = 9 May 2009 | constituency1 = | predecessor = [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Moosa Manik]] | successor = [[Ahmed Saleem (deputy speaker)|Ahmed Saleem]] | 1namedata = [[Mohamed Aslam (member of parliament)|Mohamed Aslam]] | 1blankname = Speaker | relations = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] (cousin) | otherparty = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] (2008-2023) | preceded1 = ''Constituency established'' }} '''Eva Abdulla''' ([[Maldivian language|Dhivehi]]: އީވާ ޢަބްދުﷲ; born 8 February 1978) is a Maldivian Politician who was the Deputy Speaker of the [[People's Majlis]] until resignation in 3rd of December 2023. She is a Member of Parliament.{{Cite news |last=Afeef |first=Azeeza |date=3 December 2023 |title=މަޖިލީހުގެ ނައިބު ރައީސް ކަމުން އީވާ އިސްތިއުފާ ދެއްވައިފި |language=dv |trans-title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament resigns |work=Vaguthu |url=https://vaguthu.mv/news/972796/ |access-date=2023-12-03}} She previously worked at the [[World Health Organization]], the [[United Nations Population Fund|UNFPA]], and was the Manager for the now-defunct local newspaper [[Minivan Daily]].{{Cite web |title=Deputy Speaker of the Parliament - People's Majilis of Maldives |url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230422103432/https://majlis.gov.mv/en/19-parliament/deputy-speaker |archive-date=22 April 2023 |website=People's Majilis}} She has served as a parliamentarian for three consecutive terms since 2009 for the [[Galolhu|Galolhu Uthuru]] constituency{{Cite news |date=19 June 2023 |title=Cannot remain for long without registering 'The Democrats': Eva |work=One |url=https://oneonline.mv/en/78311 |access-date=24 December 2023}} and was a longtime member of the [[Maldivian Democratic Party]], up until she left the party in May 2023. She is now a member of [[The Democrats (Maldives)|The Democrats]]. Eva was elected deputy speaker with a unanimous vote of 76 parliamentarians, making her the second woman to have ever been elected to the office. In 2019, she was the second woman to have presided over a parliament meeting as speaker, with the first being former Deputy Speaker [[Aneesa Ahmed]] in 2008.{{Cite news |last=Jalyl |first=Raif Amyl |date=11 June 2019 |title=Deputy Speaker Eva chairs parliament, second woman to do so |work=The Edition |url=https://edition.mv/news/10986 |access-date=2023-05-31}} In 2023, she resigned as deputy speaker in the midst of a [[Motion of no confidence|no-confidence motion]] being made against her by 50 parliamentarians. The motion was brought against her due to her withdrawal from the MDP in violation of an agreement that stated that she should remain an MDP candidate once elected on an MDP ticket.{{Cite news |last=Udhma |first=Fathimath |date=3 December 2023 |title=Eva resigns from post of Parliament Deputy Speaker |work=raajje.mv |url=https://raajje.mv/146089 |access-date=2023-12-13}} == Education == Eva graduated from the [[University of Kent]], holding a BA in Politics and Government and a MA in Politics and International Relations from the [[University of Warwick]], [[England]], [[United Kingdom]]. ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Abdulla, Eva}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Kent]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Warwick]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Democratic Party politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Maldivian women in politics]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian women politicians]]
